name: Xi Peng 0001
content: Greetings! I'm Xi Peng Skip to content Xi Peng (彭玺) is leading XLearning Group at the College of Computer Science, Sichuan University as a Cheung Kong Professor. From 2014 to 2017, he was a research scientist at the Institute for Infocomm, Research Agency for Science, Technology, and Research (A*STAR) Singapore. He got his Ph.D. degree from Sichuan University in 2013. His current interests mainly focus on machine learning and its applications in image processing, computer vision, multi-modal analysis, and natural language processing. In these areas, he has tried to provide novel insights to communities, and some major results are briefly highlighted below: i) proving the equivalence between F-norm (L2) and nuclear-norm (L1) under mild conditions. The theoretical results well explain why L2-norm-based representations are competitive with L1-norm-based ones in number of applications (TNNLS'16, TCYB'17a, TCYB'17b); ii) PARTY: one of the FIRST deep clustering methods (arxiv'15, IJCAI'16), which is proposed to group the complex data in an unsupervised way; iii) TELL: the FIRST interpretable unsupervised neural network which is intrinsically explainable and transparent (JMLR'22); iv) CC: it achieves state of the art for online clustering in an elegant contrastive learning fashion (AAAI'21, IJCV'22); v) Noisy Correspondence (NC): A new research DIRECTION of noisy labels learning. NC aims to address the mismatched pairs instead of annotation errors in a number of tasks, e.g., fundamental models, retrieval, Re-ID, QA, dialogue, graph matching, identification, etc. (CVPR'21, NeurIPS'21, CVPR'22, CVPR'23, TPAMI'22, ACMMM'22, AAAI'23, etc; vi) All in One Image/Video Restoration and Enhancement: for the first time, we explored this new direction which aims to handle multiple degradations with one mode (CVPR'21); v) AI4Science: My lab also attempts to explore the core problems in interdiscipline and develop specific solutions. Currently, we are diving into AI4LifeScience (Nature Communications 2023, 2024). News: [Services]: Nov. 20, 2025, I will serve for ICML 2026 as Area Chair.
